oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SMOOTHED PARTICLE HYDRODYNAMICS MODELLING OF WAVES, SHEARED CURRENTS AND LOADS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yang, Yong
Draycott, Samuel
Stansby, Peter
Rogers, Benedict D
Buldakov, Eugeny
Stagonas, Dimitris
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Waves and currents coexist and interact with each other in a wide range of coastal locations. These currents are seldom uniform with depth and typically have vertical shear which adds complexity to the wave-current interaction problem [1]. It is this, potentially complex, combined environment which subsequently determines the loading on structures making it important to accurately model for the purpose of system design. However, there exist challenges in both the experimental and numerical (re)-creation of waves in sheared currents and hence the realistic combined wave-current environment is not routinely considered.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; waves.9
